instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3190 liquid damage
threads.message:
Hello,

I got a 820-3190 with liquid damage that got under a RAM chip. Also got the beeps that confirm RAM issue. I ultrasoniced the board and now I don't even get a green light. I do have a board view file but no schematic...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3190 liquid damage
threads.message: PP3V42_G3H 0.015V, that is not good of course. Shorted?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3190 liquid damage
threads.message: Pin 1 of C6908 gives 106 KOhm resistance to ground

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3190 liquid damage
threads.message: 3V42 missing so the basics would be input voltage to U6990 on D6905 and inspect that area for damage.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3190 liquid damage
threads.message: D6905 gets no power... Power stops at Q6910. In my board view file Q6910 has 3 pins on the left and 1 on the right side. The actual chip has 4 top and 4 bottom legs...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3190 liquid damage
threads.message: Voltage on R6910 both sides and R6912?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3190 liquid damage
threads.message: R6910 pin 2 should be 6.8V as limited by the zener D6910. D6910 is dead or missing.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3190 liquid damage
threads.message: Thank you Duke, you're right. D6910 is missing. I do not have a doner board for this. Any other boards that have this component?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3190 liquid damage
threads.message: I believe all retina boards have the same input circuit.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-3190 liquid damage
threads.message: D6910 was next to the MagSafe connector, so hard to replace... But it worked! Thank you Duke!!! Case closed
